content.description:
Cloud Busting is the mixed bolted route that goes right of the ice. Start by cranking through a very strenuous overhanging section with bad feet for 3 bolts and a fixed pin, followed by the angle easing off significantly with much better feet for 3 more bolts. Gently transfer to the ice and finish at a bolted anchor on the left.

Be aware that this route felt significantly harder than M6+ on the first overhanging section for us, more in line with M7.

The bolted route to the right of the ice.
6 bolts, 1 fixed pin and a bolted anchor. A handful of screws for the ice section.

The harder mixed route that gets you onto the hanging ice. Egypt starts behind and left of the ice in the cave and climbs out on very steep moves over 5 bolts. To finish stem onto the ice and climb it to the bolted anchor.

The bolted line starting at the back of the cave on the left.
5 bolts and a handful of screws for the ice.

Hammer Horror is the pure ice version of the climb for when the pillar completely touches down, forming a dead vertical pillar for 15 meters that eases off near the top for the remaining 15 meters. Bolted anchor on the left.

Very rarely completely forms.

See Hammer Horror Gully approach description.
Standard ice rack.

This is the gully containing the rarely formed pure ice route "Hammer Horror" and two bolted mixed alternatives on either side for when the ice does not touch down. A fun half day outing with a relatively straightforward approach, this area sees very little traffic.
